comments.body: Also change the name of `$PUBLIC_IP` to `EXTERNAL_IP` appears in this script?

Missing a control header to keep the script from running away from the user. Typically this is done with a header like set -eu at the top of the file. Where there are cases you want errors to go without bailing on the user, set +e for the context of that command.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +17,21 @@echo "WRITING KUBE FILES , will overwrite the jsons, then testing pods. is kube clean ready to go?"


#Args below can be overriden when calling from cmd line.
#Just send all the args in order.

comments.body: The params are a great start, but the fact they are positional makes it awkward to pass certain flags while leaving the rest at default.  However I'm not sure how to do an argparse style parser in bash.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +32,36 @@NS="default"       # namespace

kubectl="${1:-$kubectl}"
VERSION="${2:-$VERSION}"
PUBLIC_IP="${3:-$PUBLIC_IP}" # ip which we use to access the Web server.
